template<typename T >
int32_t vrt::Utilities::binarySearch ( const vector< T > &  vec,
T  val 
) [inline]

Searches a vector for a specified element.



The name of this function is patterned after the Java function (as this provides some consistency between the Java and C++ version), but the implementation is entirely different.

Parameters:
vec The vector to search.
val The value to look for.
Returns:
Non-negative value indicating the index if found or a negative value indicating one less than the insertion point times -1.
int64_t vrt::Utilities::currentTimeMillis (  ) 

Gets the current time in milliseconds.

This function provides an interface that is fairly easy to use regardless of the platform and is similar to System.currentTimeMillis() in Java.

string vrt::Utilities::format ( const char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

Creates a string based on a format specifier and values.

This is essentially a variant of snprintf(..) that returns a new string rather than setting a char* buffer.

Parameters:
fmt The format specifier.
... The remaining format values.

Referenced by vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getChildrenSIDString(), vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getCitedSIDString(), vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getParentsSIDString(), and vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getSiblingsSIDString().

string vrt::Utilities::fromUTF8 ( const wstring  utf8,
char  replacement = '?' 
)

Converts a UTF8 string to an ASCII string.

Parameters:
utf8 The UFT8 sequence to convert.
replacement The replacement character to use if a non-ASCII character is encountered (typically '?').
Returns:
An applicable string.
Exceptions:
VRTException If replacement is null and a non-ASCII character is encountered.
void vrt::Utilities::getCurrentSystemTime ( int64_t &  sec,
int64_t &  ps 
)

Internal Use Only: Gets the current time at maximum resolution (up to picoseconds).

This function uses gettimeofday(..) *or* clock_gettime(..) *or* another other similar function to get the current system time in the "most optimal" manner.

General users should NOT use this function since it is subject to change without notice. The currentTimeMillis() is provided for more general use.

double vrt::Utilities::normalizeAngle180 ( double  deg  ) 

Normalizes an angle such that it is on the range of [-180,+180).

Parameters:
deg The input angle in degrees.
Returns:
The corresponding angle in the range [-180,+180).

boolNull vrt::Utilities::toBoolean ( const string &  obj  ) 

Converts a "boolean" string to a boolean value.

The following (case-insensitive) conversions are used: 

    _NULL:       ""
    _TRUE:       "true",  "t", "1", "yes", "y", "on"
    _FALSE:      "false", "f", "0", "no",  "n", "off"
Parameters:
obj The object to convert.
Returns:
_NULL, _TRUE, or _FALSE as appropriate.

Referenced by toBooleanValue().

bool vrt::Utilities::toBooleanValue ( const string &  obj  )  [inline]

Converts a "boolean" string to a boolean value.

The is identical to toBoolean except that it returns false in place of null.

Parameters:
obj The object to convert.
Returns:
true or false as appropriate.

References toBoolean().

Referenced by vrt::NetUtilities::getSocketOptionBool().

string vrt::Utilities::toStringClassID ( int32_t  oui,
int16_t  icc,
int16_t  pcc 
) [inline]

Converts the numeric form of a VRT class identifier to a string.

Parameters:
oui The 24-bit OUI (top 8 bits of the int must be 0x00).
icc The 16-bit (unsigned) information class code (ICC).
pcc The 16-bit (unsigned) packet class code (PCC).
Returns:
The string form of the class identifier.

References toHexString(), and toStringOUI().

string vrt::Utilities::toStringClassID ( int64_t  id  ) 

Converts the numeric form of a VRT class identifier to a string.

Parameters:
id The 56-bit class ID (top 8 bits of the long must be 0x00).
Returns:
The string form of the class identifier.
string vrt::Utilities::toStringDeviceID ( int32_t  oui,
int16_t  dev 
) [inline]

Converts the numeric form of a device identifier to a string.

Parameters:
oui The 24-bit manufacturer OUI (top 8 bits of the int must be 0x00).
dev The 16-bit (unsigned) device identifier.
Returns:
The string form of the device identifier.

References toHexString(), and toStringOUI().

string vrt::Utilities::toStringDeviceID ( int64_t  id  ) 

Converts the numeric form of a device identifier to a string.

Parameters:
id The 40-bit manufacturer OUI stored in a 64-bit space as: 0x00xxxxxx0000yyyy where xxxxxx is the 24-bit manufacturer OUI and yyyy is the 16-bit device ID.
Returns:
The string form of the device identifier.

Referenced by vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getDeviceID().

string vrt::Utilities::trim ( const string &  str  ) 

Trims excess whitespace off the front and end of a string.

This is modeled after java.lang.String.trim() and is used within the auto-generated packet code.

Parameters:
str The input string.
Returns:
The trimmed output or str if no trimming is required.
string vrt::Utilities::trimNA ( const string &  str  ) 

Trims excess whitespace off the front and end of a string and then returns "" if the result is "NA" or "N/A" (case insensitive).

Parameters:
str The input string.
Returns:
The trimmed output or str if no trimming is required.
